moves.7... dxc4 8. Bxc4 Nbd7 9. Ne5 Qe8 10. Be: White resists the exchange of Queens.

moves.19. Nc5 Nd7 20. Nxd7 Bxd7: Black has a fatal weakness on KB3, which White proceeds to exploit.

moves.22. Rc5: A nice tactical shot. If 22... BxR, 23 PxB leaves Black facing both RxB and Q-K3-R6.
moves.24. dxe5 Be6 25. Qf4 Qxb2 26. Bf1 Be7: Avoiding 26... B-N2?? 27 BxB KxB 28 Q-R6 ch.
moves.27. Qh4: Missing the immediate win by 27 R-N1! Q-Q5 (not ...QxR??? 28 Q-R6!!!), 28 R-QN4!! Q-R8 29 Q-R4!!
moves.27... Bc5: Gaining a tempo by attacking White's KB2.
moves.29. Rd3: Threatening 30 R-KB3 followed by 31 RxRP. Black must now sacrifice a piece.
moves.29... Bxf2+ 30. Qxf2 Qxf2+ 31. Kxf2 a4: The White pieces occupy the holes at KB6 and KR6 with crushing effect.
moves.32. Be2: Black has no resources left. If 32... P-R6, 33 P-N4! P-R7 34 RxRP wins at once. Black's desperate sacrifice can only delay matters.
